pr_title: Refactor the mechanism of recording error (on completed)

timeline.bodyHTML:
This recordCompleteFor makes it more clear to record for related node.
In StatisticSlot#exit of previous version, there is a judgement for max rt:

int maxStatisticRt = SentinelConfig.statisticMaxRt();
if (rt > maxStatisticRt) {
    rt = maxStatisticRt;
}

Is it still needed here or some other place?
I found that in MetricBucket

public void addRT(long rt) {
    add(MetricEvent.RT, rt);
    // Not thread-safe, but it's okay.
    if (rt < minRt) {
        minRt = rt;
    }
}

If a RT which is greater than default maxRT, it will still be added with actual value,
not quite sure about it, and the minRT seems not the same meaning as judgement of maxRT.

timeline.message:
Polish Tracer with entry.setError(ex) mechanism

Signed-off-by: Eric Zhao <sczyh16@gmail.com>

Refactor the mechanism of recording error in Entry and StatisticSlot

* Also polish related complete callbacks

Signed-off-by: Eric Zhao <sczyh16@gmail.com>

Polish Tracer with entry.setError(ex) mechanism

Signed-off-by: Eric Zhao <sczyh16@gmail.com>

Polish Tracer with entry.setError(ex) mechanism

Signed-off-by: Eric Zhao <sczyh16@gmail.com>

timeline.body:
I found that with the new design, we needn't increaseExceptionQps here(Unexpected error), which looks nicer.
By the way, `context.getCurEntry().setError(e)` looks equivalent to `Tracer.traceContext(e, context)`, and the difference is that traceContext has `shouldTrace` judgement.
Since almost never happens here, both are okay, right?
